parental_support.description: Both parents supportive, have repeatedly told her they're proud of her effort
parental_support.father_attitude: Sees her improvement, proud of her persistence, believes she will succeed

pressure_source.note: Parents have explained 'mistakes are learning opportunities' many times - verbal reassurance doesn't reach her. She puts pressure on herself.

communication.child_received: Knows parents support her, but internal critic is louder

verbatim_statements: Ostatní to umí, jen já ne

pattern_analysis.global_attribution: 'Jsem blbá' - judges SELF, not the task
pattern_analysis.self_blame: 'Já jsem to pokazila' - not 'this is tricky'

inner_critic.intervention_note: Cannot be argued away. Needs experiential change, not verbal reassurance.

constructions.pattern: Systematically skipped in 5 out of 7 tests (2017-2023)
constructions.recent_change: First attempt in M9PDD24C0T04 (2024) - partial success (2/6 points)
constructions.interpretation: Not inability - fear of visible, unjudgeable failure. Constructions leave evidence of mistakes that cannot be hidden or 'tipnut' (guessed).

sequences.interpretation: Open-ended problems without safety net cause anxiety

open_questions.pattern: Prefers multiple choice over open answers
open_questions.interpretation: Safety in elimination method - reduces risk of complete failure

consistency.interpretation: Performance heavily dependent on psychological state, not knowledge level
consistency.implication: Same child, same knowledge, vastly different outcomes = anxiety factor

evidence: Skips uncertain problems rather than attempting
Better at multiple choice (safety net exists)
Avoids problems where error is visible

response_to_difficulty.evidence: Blank answers on hard problems rather than partial attempts
response_to_difficulty.note: Recent improvement: 2024 test shows first construction attempts

social_comparison.bias: Only compares in areas where she is 'losing'

perfectionism.note: Not a perfectionist in general life, but treats mistakes as personal failure in academic context

evidence: 17-point score variance (10 vs 27) with same knowledge base

learned_helplessness.pattern: 'I can't do this' = 'I fear to try this'
learned_helplessness.evidence: Years of skipping same problem types

attribution_style.intervention_target: Shift to specific, temporary, external for failures

o_x_vice_mene.description: Systematic confusion: 'o tretinu vice' interpreted as +1/3 instead of x1.33
o_x_vice_mene.interpretation: Fixed misconception never properly corrected. Needs concrete, manipulable re-teaching.

binomial_expansion.interpretation: Procedural gap, not conceptual - needs practice and mnemonic

transfer_ability.observation: Good within familiar contexts, poor to new contexts
transfer_ability.evidence: Can solve equations but struggles when same logic appears in word problems
transfer_ability.interpretation: Needs explicit bridging between learned skills and new applications

metacognition.evidence: Some self-correction visible in work, but limited strategic thinking
metacognition.intervention: Build 'thinking about thinking' - What do I know? What do I need?

working_memory.evidence: Multi-step problems handled when familiar format
working_memory.note: Breaks down when anxiety is high

cognitive.evidence: Successful elimination method in multiple choice
cognitive.leverage: Build on this systematic thinking for other problem types
Start sessions with fraction work for confidence building

behavioral.evidence: 2024 test: First construction attempts after years of skipping
Father: 'hrozně dře' - works very hard despite difficulties

support_system.evidence: Both parents express pride and belief, unconditional support

potential.evidence: Best score of 27/50 (54%) demonstrates capability when conditions are right
potential.gap: 10-27 range shows potential unrealized due to psychological factors

risk_factors.risk: Without correction, will continue losing 4-8 points per test
Self-reinforcing: skip -> don't learn -> fear more -> skip more
risk_factors.mitigation: Gradual exposure with guaranteed success experiences

risk_factors.risk: Exam conditions may trigger worst-case performance
risk_factors.mitigation: Stress inoculation, practice under simulated conditions
Build stable baseline through consistent practice in safe environment

risk_factors.risk: External reassurance ineffective; self-sabotage under stress
risk_factors.mitigation: Experiential interventions (Chyba dne), externalization of critic, 'zatím' reframing

use: Slyším, že jsi na sebe naštvaná

activities: Error analysis as curiosity, not judgment

when_she_says_jsem_blba: Name the feeling: 'Slyším, že jsi na sebe naštvaná'
Externalize: 'Ten kritik v hlavě je dneska hlasitej'

priority_1.goal: Student explains difference in own words

priority_2.approach: Gradual exposure: steps only -> guided -> partial -> independent
priority_2.goal: Attempt all construction problems, even partially

activities: Mixed practice with new and familiar

metrics: Number of problems attempted (not just correct)

prognosis.evidence: Best performance of 27 points demonstrates capability
prognosis.key_insight: Problem is not primarily mathematical - it's harsh internal critic + fear of visible failure
prognosis.timeline: 2-3 months of systematic work for stable 25-30 point performance
prognosis.critical_success_factor: Silencing/managing inner critic before academic content focus

key_findings: Pressure is internal, not from parents
Parents have tried verbal reassurance many times - ineffective
Not a general perfectionist - academic specific
Father very supportive, realistic, wants to help
next_steps: Father to try 'Ten kritik v hlavě' externalization

notes: Profile based on analysis of 8 CERMAT tests from 2017-2024
Teacher scores used (not calculated) as they reflect actual grading standards
Positive signal: 2024 tests show first construction attempts - breaking avoidance pattern
Ultimate goal: Build app that implements these psychological principles
2024-12-24: Profile updated with parent interview data - v1.1
